title: 'AI manufacturers have stolen all our content': How creators are trying to assert their rights
summary: Creative professionals worry that the defense of culture may be sidelined at the international summit on artificial intelligence, which begins in Paris on Monday.

title: Trump arrives at Superdome for historic Super Bowl visit: 'It's an iconic day'
summary: The US president, who began his day by playing golf with Tiger Woods in Florida, heads a galaxy of VIPs and celebrities attending Sunday's game between the Kansas City Chiefs and Philadelphia Eagles.

title: Netanyahu praises Trump's 'revolutionary, creative' Gaza plan
summary: In an interview on Fox News on Saturday, the Israeli PM defended Donald Trump's proposal to move Palestinians out of Gaza and said Israel is willing to 'do the job,' later referring to the idea as 'revolutionary' and 'creative' on Sunday.

title: Macron says ready to respond to any US tariffs on Europe
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron warned that tariffs would harm European economies but also the United States, given the level of economic ties. He told CNN that the EU should not be a 'top priority' for the US after Trump's repeated threats to target the bloc, having already ordered tariffs on Canada, Mexico and China.

title: Noboa leads violence-hit Ecuador's presidential vote
summary: First returns showed incumbent leader Daniel Noboa hovering close to 50% of the vote, the total needed to avoid a second-round runoff against leftist challenger Luisa Gonzalez, who was on 38%.

title: Sleeping with 1,000 men in 12 hours: On OnlyFans, absurd challenges reflect the pressure of algorithms
summary: Lily Phillips and Bonnie Blue, two British sex workers, have engaged in a race to set extreme 'records.' These staged challenges highlight the harsh economic realities behind the platform's success.

title: Trump's presence at Super Bowl adds political dimension to the event
summary: The US president is expected in New Orleans on Sunday for the American football championship final between the Philadelphia Eagles and the Kansas City Chiefs. A sitting president has not attended the event since 1966.

title: Baltic states successfully plug in to European power grid
summary: Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania disconnected from Russia's power network on Saturday morning and connected to the European grid on Sunday in a historic move.

title: Trump says Musk will help uncover 'hundreds of billions' in US government fraud
summary: The president appointed SpaceX and Tesla boss Elon Musk to lead his federal cost-cutting efforts under the newly created advisory team Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE). Democrats have lined up to slam Trump's various efforts, including Senator Chris Murphy, who on Sunday warned of an 'assault on the Constitution.'

title: Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI: 'On AI, France has created a playbook that other European nations should follow'
summary: The head of OpenAI, the company that developed ChatGPT, writes that France has become a hub for AI in Europe, and calls on European regulators to reflect on the consequences of their decisions on tomorrow's opportunities.

title: How far will artificial intelligence go?
summary: With hundreds of billions of dollars of investment announced by the American OpenAI and the revolutionary technology of China's DeepSeek, the sector is developing at lightning speed. But there are questions surrounding a superior intelligence, along with concerns about its autonomy. Here's a look at the current state of play.

title: 'The male gender has historically been built around the idea of ownership of women's bodies'
summary: Political masculinism, embodied in particular by presidents Trump and Putin, is a virilist reaction to the #MeToo movement, according to the historian. She urges men to reflect on the gender issue and how masculinity has been constructed.

title: Uncertainty surrounds next stages of Gaza ceasefire
summary: The three Israelis released by Hamas on Saturday, in exchange for 183 Palestinian prisoners, were clearly suffering from malnutrition. In response, Benjamin Netanyahu ordered a reduction in humanitarian aid for the Palestinian enclave.

title: Israeli military withdraws from key Gaza corridor
summary: As part of the ceasefire, Israel agreed to remove its forces from the 6-kilometer Netzarim corridor, a strip of land that bisects northern Gaza from the south.

title: Kendrick Lamar promises 'storytelling' at Super Bowl halftime show
summary: Ahead of Sunday's final between Kansas City Chiefs and the Philadelphia Eagles, the rapper said he had never imagined he would perform at the Super Bowl when he was starting out.

title: How some French towns have managed to better protect themselves against floods
summary: With more than a quarter of the French population being exposed to flooding risks from overflowing rivers, several towns, notably in southern France, have set up projects that have proven efficient.

title: French studios where 'Emilia Pérez' was filmed set to double in size
summary: To finance seven new film and audiovisual studios, the French government is expected to contribute €30 million of the planned €120 million.

title: Robert Fico, the Slovak leader who has made Ukraine his 'enemy'
summary: The prime minister makes no secret of his closeness to Vladimir Putin's Russia rather than the European Union. This is much to the dismay of some Slovaks, who are stepping up demonstrations.

title: Narendra Modi's party regains power in New Delhi after a 27-year absence
summary: After the Hindu nationalists' narrow victory in the spring 2024 general election, their return to control of the capital indicates that Prime Minister Narendra Modi's popularity remains intact.

title: At the Luis Rubiales trial, the sisterhood of female footballers and the conspiracy of Spanish Football Federation executives
summary: The first days of court hearings in the case of the kiss Jenni Hermoso was subjected to by the former RFEF head on the evening of La Roja's victory at the 2023 World Cup have brought to light the harassment suffered by the player and those close to her.

title: Government chiefs and tech leaders gather in Paris for AI summit
summary: Co-hosted by French President Emmanuel Macron and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the gathering's stated aims include 'mapping' AI governance around the world. Political leaders, including US Vice President JD Vance and Chinese Vice Premier Zhang Guoqing, are set to rub shoulders with OpenAI boss Sam Altman and Google chief Sundar Pichai.

title: The Paris AI Summit, a challenge in a fragmented world
summary: France is hosting a world summit on artificial intelligence at a time when the US wants to outpace China and is challenging European regulations.

title: Eagles crush Chiefs 40-22 to win Super Bowl
summary: The Philadelphia Eagles are the Super Bowl LIX champions, shattering the Kansas City Chiefs' hopes for a historical 'threepeat' victory.

title: Super Bowl 2025 ads: Snoop Dogg, David Beckham, Glen Powell, Ben Affleck... a lot of celebrities, some laughs and a dash of politics
summary: Fox charged a record $8 million for a 30-second spot during Sunday’s game between the Philadelphia Eagles and the Kansas City Chiefs.

title: Kendrick Lamar brings America and 'Not Like Us' into history-making Super Bowl halftime show
summary: Kendrick Lamar is the first solo hip-hop artist to ever headline the coveted Super Bowl halftime slot.

title: Design: Five exhibitions showcasing dazzling pieces of furniture in Paris
summary: A solid wood table inlaid with gold, a mirror blurred with silver leaf and a cabinet with a base adorned with precious stones are among the pieces that can be discovered in the capital's galleries.
